item.title: Scholarships for Opportunity and Results Reauthorization Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 564.

item.title: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term "Fiduciary".

latestAction.text: Motion to refer the bill and accompanying veto message to the Committee on Education and the Workforce. The Chair directed the Clerk to notify the Senate of the action of the House.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 183 (Roll no. 174). (text: CR H2076)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 183 (Roll no. 174).(text: CR H2076)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 182 (Roll no. 173). (consideration: CR H2080)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 706.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2076-2081)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 110.
Resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4901 and H.J. Res. 88.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-533, by Ms. Foxx.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-533, by Ms. Foxx.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4901) to reauthorize the Scholarships for Opportunity and Results Act, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 88) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term "Fiduciary"; and providing for proceedings during the period from May 2, 2016, through May 9, 2016.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4901) to reauthorize the Scholarships for Opportunity and Results Act, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 88) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term "Fiduciary"; and providing for proceedings during the period from May 2, 2016, through May 9, 2016.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
